25%, but as with most numbers, could possibly change with tuning.

I believe Surrender@20 caught one of the designers saying that they have to be at or below 25% health. Once pulled in, it will deal that much damage to you, plus a little more, in true damage.

Even if the target being pulled in happens to get above 25% while being pulled in (say, a Raka ult before being killed), they still die.

So, once hooked by Urgot, you have nothing more but to accept your fate. That, or somehow pray your team can kill him before he reels you in, since that it is the only true way to stop his ult once hooked.

It's also been mentioned that Yas and Braum can wall the Ult chains and kayle, bard, and Kindred ults stop the kill if they are getting dragged in. No mention on Morgana being able to stop it so that's a wait and see.

Meddler, most of these past reworks have made me sad or angry. But this...this makes me have hope. I fell in love with Urgot and was sad to lose him, but for once I am excited to have a champion I'm passionate about reworked. Wow.

Agreed, this looks fantastic! I personally had no idea that the devs would even keep Urgot in his current niche, yet the kit seems to preserve his jugger-marksman hybrid nature and make it work. The VGU process feels closer to Sion's than to Warwick's, as he definitely received some pretty drastic work (all of his abilities got changed pretty heavily), yet much of his core characteristics, including his lock-on, personal shield, crab legs, position swap, etc. still remain. I was worried after Galio's rework that VGUs would stop caring as much about a champion's previous identity, but this proved me wrong entirely.

One of the things I like the most about Urgot's new kit, besides his meaty ult, is his innate. Not only does it kick major thematic ass (S H O T G U N K N E E S), but it's one of those passives that really frames how a champion plays. Personally, I think a champion's innate is/should be the most important part of their kit, since it's available to them from the start and is therefore always on, and is the perfect opportunity to really set the foundation for a completely unique playstyle via a cool or unusual mechanic. In this case, I really feel it's going to force Urgot to play in a manner completely unique to him, and the fact that his entire basic ability set complements his innate means it's also likely going to feel organic to him (Urganic? Or, at least as organic as Urgot can get...), rather than a "minigame", as was the case for a few other additions to previous champion kits.
